runs.comm: on his legs, nudged to leg
defended solidly on the back foot
edged wide of second slip! Good ball there from Mills
left alone by the right hander
smash! Take that. He has absolutely laced this past point for four. What a shot that was
pushed back to the bowler
good start on off stump, swinging back into Smith who defends
punched out to cover
neatly timed out to point. Vincent dives, saves, throws down the stumps but misses
goddim! A straight bouncer from Gillespie which Kallis hooks straight down fine-leg's throat
full and straight, punched on the front foot back to the bowler
well bowled - that is a corker from Gillespie. A heavy ball, much quicker than Smith anticipated and (like the South Africans found to their benefit) plenty of bounce too
left alone outside off
well bowled, nice and straight and Duminy defends - with a very side-on stance
too short - only just, mind - and Duminy pounces on it, pulling it over midwicket for four
tip-and-run from Duminy, dropping this out to the off side and they scamper for a single
back in his crease, he defends
well bowled - nice and full, and Smith flicks it to leg at the last moment
short and wide, Smith plays and misses but is beaten by a lack of bounce. A real pea-shooter there, though Smith didn't help his cause by not moving his feet
beaten by another cracker, lifting and moving away from Smith who plays and misses
again Smith is cramped for room, punching this to cover but again he can't get a run
elegantly and powerfully driven but straight to mid-off
oh, shot! He did move his feet this time, waiting and waiting on that back foot before late-cutting it with power past backward point
good comeback from Gillespie, cramping Smith for room who defends on the back foot
ugly but effective. Duminy pulls this through midwicket for four. It wasn't that short, but he absolutely nailed it
inside edge for four down to third man! Well, that could've gone anywhere...but such is the way of Twenty20
Duminy tries to work it to leg but the ball takes the top of the pad and flies through to McCullum who can't take it cleanly and receives a painful blow for good measure
shot! My word he nailed that. Flat-batted over midwicket for six
slower ball which Duminy pushed out to cover and they scamper a single
goddim! Smith's poor run of form continues as he plays a horrid, cross-batted stroke and gets a thick outside edge to McCullum
oh well done first slip! A bouncer which flies over the batsman, and over the wicketkeeper, and the first slip back-peddles to collect. Excellent cricket
angled out to cover
de Villiers stands tall and punches it out to the off side
well fielded by backward point. A firm punch
village bowling, winging this miles down the leg side. Excellent take by a diving McCullum
another cracker from Gillespie! A beautiful inswinger into de Villiers, cutting him in half and the bowler and keeper go up for an appeal, but it missed everything
top shot, pouncing on this leg-side-drifter and creaming it for four through midwicket
punched to mid-on
a touch short, nudged to leg
a little fuller but de Villiers can't do anything with it, pushing it out meekly to cover

guided out to cover...oh dear, the throw comes in from the enthusiastic Vincent who flicked it behind him (ala the All Blacks' scrum half in the 1990s whose name I've forgotten)...but they grab overthrows
defended on the front foot
oh, clever bowling - much, much quicker and de Villiers is hurried into pushing this back to the bowler

dropped! de Villiers tried to launch Vettori into the car park but skied it, miles, to Mills at long-off who ran in a good ten metres, but he couldn't get both hands to it...and parries it onto the boundary
pushed out to cover
very quick hands from Duminy - he is seriously quick on the pull - and swats this through midwicket. No placement though
angles this down to third man and grabs a single
short and pulled for four. Magnificent timing
again short; again he pulls, but without that magnificent timing
angled to third man
take that! Down the pitch from Duminy; down on one knee, smiting this over midwicket for a massive six. Brillliant
down the pitch again, flicking it to leg
ooh but he's beaten here, trying to whip it to leg but is beaten by the pace and bounce and gets a leading edge to point
de Villiers is rapped on the pad here, beaten by pace and spin
timed out to deep extra
gone! Very well bowled from Vettori, beating Duminy in the flight. He came prancing down the pitch, was beaten by the turn and McCullum does the rest.
a slower ball, flicked to leg
too short, he pulls this through midwicket
pushed out to extra cover
dropped! What a complete hash from Gillespie, running in from midwicket and he drops a skier. Quite how, I do not know
pushed out cover but it's a no-ball
wide of the off stump, de Villiers throws his bat at it and pings it out to cover
a bouncer which he evades
defended
quicker, darted in and he punches it to mid-off
short and wider this time from Vettori and he is cut, without timing it, out to a deep point
well bowled - good length here but it's cannily played by the right hander who whips it to leg for a single
flicked through midwicket
pushed out to extra cover
slower ball, flicked through midwicket
great ball, cutting him in half. It moved quite a bit off the seam, jagging back nastily
a touch too short, he pulls this through midwicket
this has been utterly spanked over midwicket. What a fantastic shot. Short of a length, de Villiers rocks back and hammers it in front of square for six. Several rows back, too
beautifully driven out to Patel on the deep extra-cover boundary who nearly makes a hash of it, before winging in a good throw
much, much too short and it's pulled to deep midwicket
nudged to midwicket for a single
late cut to a short third man who does well to prevent the single
he's got him! Boucher went for the sweep, was beaten by the turn and up goes the finger. He is decidedly unhappy
patted out to cover
well bowled, a fast yorker which is dug out
timed to long-on
driven out to cover
magnificently driven for four through extra cover. And he held the pose, too
pushed out to cover
nudged to leg
worked through square leg
nudged through the off side. It beats the first fielder, then a diving second at mid-off - terrible fielding, to be honest
punched down to long-on
on middle stump, Pollock simply works it to leg for another single
gone! Taylor's taken a blinder at deep midwicket, as Pollock tried to pull this but couldn't time it. Taylor, crouching low, took it inches above the turf and a metre inside the rope
McCullum yelps half an appeal as this hurries the left-hander into a defensive prod
too short, Morkel pulls it without really timing through midwicket
a full toss which is pumped down the ground
he comes confidently forward, stroking this out to extra cover
flicked through midwicket
beaten! Oh well bowled Vettori - he's been superb tonight. He comes forward but is beaten by the turn
pushed back to the bowler
ooh, he gets a top edge on this pull - that could have gone anywhere. And it was a long-hop, too, which ought to have been dispatched into the stands
pushed out to cover
and it's defended, solidly
well bowled! McCullum thinks so too, roaring his approval as it's defended in a hurry
ooh close! Very close to getting a stump-shattering inside edge there
but here's the big hit from Morkel with a Klusener-like pull for six over midwicket. Pure, ugly power
again he's beaten - that could so easily have been dragged onto his stumps
pushed to leg for a single
Morkel lines up a massive smite but instead works it to midwicket
gone, beaten by the offie! Morkel mistimes it straight to Vettori at cover. A wasteful stroke, frankly
well bowled. Nice and full, swinging into the new batsman who clunks it back to him
worked to long-on for an easy single
a neat paddle down to fine leg, who is a little square and jogs around to save four
he stands tall and punches it to long-on for another simple single
dug out to cover
outside the off stump, he shuffles across and works it to leg
ooh and he's almost turned around here, and gets a leading edge to long-off
and he smacks this straight down the ground. He won't get four, but it was well timed nevertheless
he tries to late-cut this - a cry of catch it, but it falls short of a short third man. Good grief, why are South Africa even in this position? They've made a right hash of it
close! Very close to getting an inside edge here
full toss which he guides to short third man who fields. The non-striker is halfway down the pitch; third man throws down the stumps, misses, and the batsman throws himself back behind the line!
cut to short third man again who lines up a throw. There's a mix-up between the batsmen and Vincent, at the non-striker's end, collects the ball and shatters the stumps to dismiss Philander!
de Villiers cracks this over the top - will it go all the way? No, it falls short and they can only get a single

Botha pulls, but top-edges it over the wicketkeeper! He can't get to it, McCullum, and nor can Styris - both of them swarming on the spiralling ball like a pair of wasps, but they just can't get to it in time. What a mess it is out there!
and he's done it! A beautiful, calm flick from Botha through midwicket brings him four and, with it, the match for South Africa
